1.content:
Now we have the fighters established, let's establish the type of battling that should take place, shall we?

Battling Extra: This is basically people in the rankings (And other people) Doing all kinds of crap that may ensue hilarity, weirdness, or screwed up stuff. Also...this is definitely for when someone is bored and wants to put something.

Diary series: During the creation of this interactive story I had created poems based on these characters and their backstories and I have to admit they are pretty good. No I am not going to post those poems, but I am going to flesh out some of these ranked people's backstories and how some of them interact with each other/ what they have to do with each other.

Free-world: The world is a large place and all these people are spread out in that large place, waiting for their next opponent. Fact: This was the original story design.

Ranked-bio: This is the option where you see the bio of the ranked people (And unmentioned others) to see their appearance, battle styles, weaponry, background, etc.

Other: More crap to put these guys through

Special fact: This entire story was actually originally a type of storage system for characters to use...
1.title: The form of battling

11.content:
Well, let's see how we are going to organize the random crap that is going to occur here. Also note that there is a chance some of these may be used in the stories...or whatever happens in the stories go here. Which I really doubt, but whatever.

Crude/Sexual: The word that comes into mind is "Japan" So essentially fan-service in the droves with oppai, pantsu, yuri, yaoi, incest etc. With also the abuse of certain characters. Also, don't go hard into the ground with this stuff.

School drama: This just doesn't apply to high school. Combat schools, fighting schools, etc. Anywhere you can learn something counts.

Slice of life humor: The humor in the everyday lives of certain people in the rankings...which is basically saying "...What is wrong with your life?" The spectrum of this is pretty wide, actually.

Violent: Where something comedic happens from one's violence that makes it memorable...or someone is just violent and something happens...or essentially seeing death scenes that I had once thought of but...yeah you might see some spoilers for certain people.

Random f'n shite: No holds barred...just no holds barred...random crap ahoy with no limits! Just don't spam random crap. Translation: The 'everything else' section.

112.content:
Also before you ask, I actually had this planned out a long time ago, I just forgot to add this in and these schools do impact the story a lot and goes in deeply into the entire story of the battling 101 itself.

Again, optional to read as this is literally one gigantic info dump.

Also these people are battle crazy holy crap and despite having specified schools for beating the living crap out of each other like its a fighting game that is on steroids where people bring swords to dog fights and actually win...These guys actually still learn something so they aren't battle-hungry barbarians that turn into badasses one way or another...well most of them.

Before going into school related stuff, there is some things to know. Besides the regular schools, there are 8 major combat schools around the world. One of which is BOC Academy. Which is in America.

BOC Academy: The fighting academy where one can easily obtain high learning in certain fields of fighting in such things like swordsmanship, marksmanship, or demolitions. Though this place is known for its efficiency, there is always its reputation of being surprisingly wild which these people would go on war with each other which they end up creating a WWIII simulator. Though, this is surprisingly good for teaching combat as they always get a hands-on example of their certain field, of course they are mostly using wooden blades, blanks, rubber bullets, and other things...MOSTLY.

Summary: In terms of an RPG, this academy pretty much assesses you with giving you a class or title of your character and then you either leave the school becoming whatever you desire (Although these guys enforce the living crap out of morals and all things good) You can go to one of the 7 schools.

The 7 schools refer to the 7 best specialized combat academies in the world in which each specializes in certain fields where you advance your abilities even further. Although you do not have to attend BOC academy, it would be recommended.

Highland castle: The highland castle is a academy that is in the Scottish highlands which this is a medieval-style academy which they actually do have proper plumbing and technology so you don't have to worry about that. The specialization in the highlands is essentially blade and shield specialty which gun-blades and gun shields are most definitely enforced here. The size of the highland castle is quite large and although medieval, this is one place that you should not screw with because these guys have some big cannons that are absolutely ridiculous.

Desert Bunker: An underground academy in Australia which this place specializes in thermal, desert tactics and survival, scavenging/ Juryrigging, unarmed, and explosives. The desert bunker is a giant series of bunkers connected together through a complex and intricate design of passageways and other things. By the way, it's not claustrophobic in there. This place you shouldn't screw with in the first place mainly because this continent already has about 75% of its indigenous animals that can potentially kill them and the fact that these guys are in Australia.

Sea Fort: A specially made academy that not only reaches above water, but also connects underwater to the sea ground. This is pretty much close to Antarctica and these people are trained specifically to naval, underwater, and tactical warfare. So essentially, all of these people are mainly a support group, but a quite deadly one at that. One main reason for not fighting these people is the fact that these guys know how to defend their position and will demolish you no matter what the heck you bring (Unless its a nuclear bomb) Also, these guys are also known for research and development which is all confidential under the sea floor.

Flying Domain: As it says, it is pretty much a flying island which is only up using some high-end, anti-gravity technology. These people are essentially specialists in, of course, flying tactics, although it may seem simple, these guys are pretty much trained to excel in dog-fights, hit-and-run tactics, search-and-rescue missions, quick evacuations and other things. So basically its another support group, and one that you do not want to fight their army with as they have some big flying death machines. Also this is somewhere above Europe

Frozen Bastion: Essentially it was originally a giant fortification that was transformed into a combat academy...which this is in Russia. The Frozen Bastion specializes in winter tactics, guns, artillery, and defensive tactics. The only thing I have to say is that these guys are tough, intimidating, and will make you feel the wrath of mother Russia.

Underground Citadel: A giant underground citadel under south-America , which these people are specialists in stealth, assassination, deception, secrecy, pretty much all behind-the-scene, cloak and dagger stuff. One main reason why you shouldn't mess with these people is that they have eyes and ears everywhere and they can kill you in your sleep.

Dragon Temple: In technical terms, this thing actually has 5 branches: Vietnam, China, Japan, korea, and India. But all of them pretty much are the same thing, which all of them specializes in the supernatural, so basically expect people to have some mystical power or be insanely powerful. The fact that the name is dragon temple and where the dragon temple is even at...Yeah that is not going to be good.

Regular schools: They are regular schools which this is basically pointing towards high school...for the most part.

With all of these in mind, you actually can actually just make a comedic school moment without the need of adding characters from the 101 or any stuff. Just add people in and let the good times role.
112.title: Intro to school drama section

1121.content:
*Note, moved from its original spot to add in School Drama intro*

"BOC Academy, an esteemed school that-...Oh you know what I am not going to even try" *Insert scenes of people beating the living crap out of each other with assorted weapons* "This place is an utter shithole with idiots that almost kill themselves and others. Not only is this place always a complete warzone, but the teachers are doing absolute-" The microphone of the MC was taken "Hey! What-" The person that took it was Jenkins, ranked 101, which basically a guy who is wearing all grey casual with a wooden mask on.
"Oy', you know that half the stuff you're saying is exaggerated and bullcrap, right?"
"But it's true, these people keep fighting each other to death!"
"You know that no one has actually died at this school, right? Though it's true this place is a warzone, its a maintained warzone and we are watching. Besides, it's thanksgiving, do something thanksgiving related!" Jenkins gave the MC her microphone and she got back to speaking
"Well, now that's it's thanksgiving, the students are going to do their traditional weapon exchange, which means that all of their weapons are replaced with something thanksgiving related...well this is going to be messy and its a good thing the person that cleans all this up is a master at his work..."

-Outside-

The basic description of this: People that were melee-based are either using oversized turkey legs or regular sized turkey legs and beating the living crap out of each other, people who uses explosives are using exploding turkey, those with guns are shooting...well I think they're shooting bones, and those people who use heavy-ordinance weaponry are using turkey and big slabs of ham...Yeah it's very messy, chaotic, and the mother of all food fights. Also Jenkins just joined in the fray and is currently knocking students out with half-eaten turkey legs.
"I wonder who took a bite out of my weapons..." After he said that he kicked a flying turkey that was going to hit the back of his head. When he turned around he saw the student with the artillery that shot it at him and that guy ran "Hey, get back here so I can shove this turkey down your throat!" Jenkins disappeared into a cloud of grey smoke.

-Inside-

The inside is actually normal as students are actually setting up for the thanksgiving event that occurs later in the day. Of course occasionally there is the stray turkey that goes flying through the windows and the student that manages to break through the wall, it was still a lot more peaceful than what was going on outside. The only things that happen in here that were significant are the accidents that occur, like so:
Several students were setting up decorations in the hallways when a turkey came flying through the window and hit one of them behind the head, unfortunately that person had EXTREME anger management issues.
"Damn it, those guys should learn to aim!" The other people with him tried to stop him by dog piling him, but that didn't do crap as he broke out of the dog pile, launching them all in different directions and he literally ran through the wall to beat the living crap out of the guy that launched the turkey.
"Well...Everyone is dead" One of the students said as he fell unconscious

-Cafeteria-

Well...Surprisingly out of all of the place they could've fought, no one had actually went to a death battling in the cafeteria. Everyone was either talking about the warzone that occurred earlier in the day or the decoration successes and blunders.

-Gymnasium-

...Today we are having exploding turkey dodgeball, you get hit you are out, the team that gets their entire team decimated loses, go! Just don't aim your bombs at the gym teacher unless you want to know what getting hit by a bullet train in Japan feels like.

-Chemistry-

No one dares to even cough in here unless you want the chemistry teacher to literally reduce you to the worthless pile of goo you are...also any weapon used here or anything that goes through the window is turned to either ashes or to their original parts (IE Steel swords becoming steel blocks)

-Dorms-

Again, nothing spectacular here. Just friends in their rooms being friends...And also preventing stray turkey from going through their windows. Which speaking of there is a man on the rooftop with a sniper rifle shooting whatever turkey comes near and shooting warning shots at people who are apart of the turkey wars to not get close within a certain parameter.

-Later in the day-

Everyone that were in the turkey wars are now all pooped and everyone in the school are all eating their thanksgiving dinner at either their families home or are staying here for the finale of the turkey wars. The MC got onto the mike and said
"Okay everybody! This day has been hectic, but all good things come to an end. Now let's continue on with the Turkey War awards, shall we?" (Yes you can get awards from the Turkey Wars. Which is not a reason to join the Turkey War for the pure reason that you will forget about it with all the flying food and bones and all of that. And yes there is people keeping track of the chaos and students) Also, we're skipping the awards ceremony and going ahead on the highlights that occurred. Remember that student who tried to hit Jerry Jenkins with flying turkey and that other student that got hit? Well guess who got an award and got tracked down to the ceremony by the beserker.

Now let's see the finale. All the explosives experts set up firework cannons and fire specialized fireworks which not only were the explosions thanksgiving related, but it didn't smell like sulfur and gunpowder, it was more like the burning smell of turkey...

And that marks the end of the Turkey Wars. Now for the next setup that will occur on Christmas eve, oh boy this is going to be madness again...

Oh right the clean-up. There is a guy there that had created an army of robots that were made specifically to clean-up and repair things at a effective rate. Just, whatever you do, don't try to fight the robots. Although they make good practice dummies they will wreck you in how large their numbers are.

-End-
1121.title: School Turkey Wars

12.content:
War Diaries: The section that involves people that were in the military at one point.

Wanderer Diaries: The section that involves people that have traversed the world in all its brutal beauty. People who apply are nomadic, been to a vast variation of places, or other things. Adventurers also apply.

Assassins Diaries: The section that involves people who were assassins.

Warrior Diaries: The section meant for people who are born to fight.
12.title: Diary series

121.content:
Ranked 98: Joseph Steghorn - Strangely enough he has never been in a war nor any type of battle...except the battle of his life. This is where his journey of being in the military begins in, the disease and foul-ridden swamp that will devour anyone that dare trespass upon it. Of course he survives, but what happened exactly?

Ranked 81: Jessica Navis - In the military she was regarded as one of the most psychotic and blood-thirsty soldiers that has ever been seen on the battlefield. In fact in one point, during a battle was commencing, all of her allies pulled back so that they wouldn't be caught in her explosive rampage. She has one of the highest recorded damage ratings to the environment, the highest kill-count, largest friendly-fire incidents, and the only person to be shot by both ally and enemy to stop her from blowing everything up. But what happened before that?

121332.title: more

1213321.content:
"How do you know the bitter taste of death? Is it the repercussions of a gruesome war or is it torture after one faces endless torture after having your own tongue removed? Is it the chance of death in an unknown place or that no one will know nor care if you died? The answer to that is simple, when you taste life, but then taste death in the end"

-Murphy Mulder


I can't remember the last time I have seen the sun...I can't remember the last time I felt something other than pain and misery. All I can hear is the buzzing and clanging of torture devices, the screams of fellow lost souls subjugated on equal or worse terms than me. Everyday I can hear the sounds of war going on, which that alone kept me up endlessly. I can't count the days, weeks, or probably months that I have been trapped in this hell hole. All that time, being shackled down in a dim, dark stone room, one that is filthy with rust and caked blood, the smell of rotten flesh in the air and so is the hint of vomit, poop, and urine. The flies that inhabit my torture chamber are the only company I have, but very deadly company as I feel like something is growing inside of my open wounds.

My tongue was cut off long ago, my torturers at one point stopped interrogating me and just tortured me for their own amusement, those sadistic bastards, whether they wanted me to shut up or just wanted to see me squirm in my own blood and pain, I could figure both. I just wanted this to all end, I just want to die, at this point of time even if I get rescued, I can never forget this place, the amount of trauma I have suffered is something no ordinary man should endure for the rest of their lives...That is if they can get out. From that point, all I can taste is blood and rotting flesh.

Faith and hope is two things that I have given up many a time ago, as god will not save our souls from the depths of hell itself. Is there really another place after life? Is there heaven...is there hell? After all of this, I just want to rest peacefully...one moment of bliss, no misery, no pain...just somewhere I can see the sky, the sun, feel the wind and smell air that isn't hell. Someone...please...if I die...someone give me a burial that will put my soul at rest...but I know no one will hear this, as I cannot speak and I know that when I die, my body will be cast out as another rotten corpse...

I think I feel what the brink of death looks like. My vision has darkened, as if it wasn't dark already. I can't feel any pain, I feel nothing but the cold steel of my iron bindings and my prison. For some reason I can't hear the sounds of war that usually reverberate throughout this place nor do I hear the screams of tortured souls that inhabit the devil's den, I know my hearing isn't down yet, but I strike this as odd. As much as I would like to check, I can hardly move that much anymore and I am sure I am going to die soon, yet I am sure I should have died a long time ago...is my will still strong enough to pull through?

Nothing...Nothing...That is all I hear nor I do see the usual torturers...What is going on? When I fell asleep for once in ages I woke up with my chains smashed and the door open. When I first saw it, I thought it was a dream, but even so, even if it was one, I wanted to see the ending of the dream, one that would lead outside into the open air so I can look up at the sky and sun...Even if it is fake, it would make me happy to see it one last time until I die. With whatever strength I had, with what remains of my will, with what kept me alive for all this time, I had managed to move for the first time in ages. I walked through the open door and for once I can see something else than my small, confined room.

Its time to escape...from this prison of hell itself with what remains of my humanity and my strength.
1213321.title: Prisoner of War

choices: The second part of ones mind
12133211.content:
No matter where I look, I just see endless corridors of stone. The dim lighting made the atmosphere seem like I was in some sort of horror story, except that this was real life and it was the reality of war. Every step I take echoes throughout the empty prison, no matter where I look, no matter how many doors I open, I cannot find anyone. No prisoners, no guards, nothing, I can only smell blood, rotting flesh, and human waste, and for whatever reason I can smell the aftermath of a warzone. Strangely enough, even with all I have heard over the time of my occupation, I literally cannot find any traces of anyone in this prison, just only the torture tools, but that is all, yet all of this smell remains. Where am I? Where is this place? What is this place? These are all questions that may not get answered, but I have a feeling that I might find out.

From time to time, I vomit, but this isn't food that I'm upchucking...it's blood...black blood...it might be the lighting, but I don't think blood is supposed to look something like that...What's happening to me? Is this from all the torture I have endured all this time along with the adverse affects done to my body? I need to get out soon, but these corridors just seem to stretch forever.

To add more suffering, I keep having sharp headaches periodically and my vision had started to fade in and out, I think I might be losing my mind because I could have sworn that I just saw someone moving in the shadows...and I could hear someone's voice.

I think, my sanity is going to shatter, from one moment I am in in a stone corridor of a prison, now everything seems to be changing. The corridor seemed to have widened and the area around me seemed to have changed drastically. Now, everything seems to be covered in blood and aged with time, and from what I can see with the wheelchairs and...I think those are called gurney's, I think this is a hospital. I did what I have been doing, just walking forward until I reach something at the end.

The atmosphere turned violent the moment that the dim lights had suddenly turned on brightly and the quiet sound that surrounded the area suddenly blasted into screams of pain and the sounds of medical instruments turning on with the gross sounds of flesh and bone being cut off. I started to run for some reason, something about this place is definitely wrong and I didn't even want to know what was going on. While I was running I sudden fell down to the ground and hit the floor with a resonating thud. When I checked to see what happened, I saw that my legs were cut off somehow, though despite that I still couldn't feel anything. While I was looking at my legs, the lights started to flicker and far off in the distance of the corridor a door opened and out came a soldier medic, but many things were off about him.

Even from this distance, I could see that he was far from normal as it looked like he was partially blown away by some sort of explosive. When he turned around in my direction, I could see his face fully as I saw that he had a bullet hole through his forehead. In his hands I can see that he had some sort of bloodied, rusted small-blade in his hand. The minute he started walking toward me, was my initiative to run, but even if my legs were gone and this was futile, it was in anyone's to try and avoid death even with the chances little to none. That was when I received a sharp headache and I grabbed my head in response to the pain as I heard voices,
"Hold his wounds damn it!" Someone yelled as there was gunfire and sounds of explosives
"Sergeant, Nate won't stop bleeding!" Murphy heard his own voice
"Private Mulder, put him out of his misery!" His sergeant said
"But-"
"No buts! Those are for our boots to shove up those asshole's assholes!"
"He's still-"
"What did I just say!" The sound of someone screaming was heard
"Jackson is down!" Someone yelled
"Sergeant, we have to retreat!" Someone else yelled
"Mulder!" The sound of war was coming closer
"Nate...I'm sorry...I'm...sorry!" A gunshot was heard. A tear went down my face as he looked back to see that the medic was right behind me. "Nate...is that you?" The medic raised his blade over his head
"I'm a fallen angel" He droved his blade into my chest and twisted it, causing the sound of flesh and bone to come out. When he forcibly pulled it out, I suddenly felt my heart burn agonizingly, I grabbed my chest in response, but then, the person who I think is Nate, then slashes my arm off and impaled my other one into the ground. Without another word, he grabbed my throat and started to choke me out. The last things I saw was that he mouthed a couple words until my vision went black.

Later, I opened my eyes and saw that I was someplace different. Somehow, from the long corridors, I have ended up in some sort of infirmary of some sort, but I could tell I was still not out of my predicament. I got up from my bed and approached the door went I had another sharp headache,
"I...forgive you" A voice said as my headache suddenly had gone away. What was that? When I opened the door, I saw a flash of light and saw myself somewhere different from the long, continuous corridor.
12133211.title: Draining sanity

121332111.content:
While I was still recovering from the white flash of light, a sudden gust of cold wind had sent shivers down my spine, my legs feel like they’re buried, and my entire body feels frozen solid. When my vision had completely cleared up I found myself in the middle of a snow-biome forest which my lower half was half buried into the ground. When I got myself out I was shivering down to the core and I began to walk in a random direction, forcing my legs to move through the snow.

I’m not sure how long I’ve been wandering aimlessly nor do I know how I’ve been going at it for this long. I would be dead by now, but at this point anything would be accepted. This cold really would’ve helped my pain awhile back because I literally cannot feel anything, I’m not even sure if my brain is even working and this is all some twisted dream my subconscious decided to create because it hates me as much as I hate myself. When my vision started fading in and out I kept seeing people in winter-camo uniform coming in and out between the fading. They were all translucent or silhouettes with each passing moment, 1 by 1, they would all disappear. The white coat of the land was slowly dotted with the color red as the sky had clearly darkened and had gotten ‘war somber’ and all around can the echoes and sounds of war could be heard.

I look around more and see shadows and silhouettes running through the trees while at the same time trees’ were falling left and right and so were people. I began running quickly, I don’t know why, but I had the feeling of fear and anxiety that I shouldn’t be in this place in particular. Thought it should be obvious to anyone with common sense, it wasn’t the battle I feared of, it was those who were in it that I felt afraid of and I don’t know why.

I no longer felt cold, just fear and the feeling of being stalked gripping me, I began holding my ears when I started to hear the gross sounds of flesh clashing and slicing flesh and bone. The screams of my allies in pain, agony, or maybe the gurgling of their own blood, I don’t know, I was just afraid of dying that I just run…I really wasn’t cut out for this and yet here I am, being a fool used as cannon fodder.

As if things weren’t any worse I had ran into someone, a person that had definition and wasn’t a silhouette or transparent. What was bad was the fact that he was covered in blood that was frozen over and that he held 2 knives that were pure red with blood stains. What was bad was that he started walking towards me; he didn’t seem to be in a hurry because I was frozen with fear, not frostbite. I wanted to run, I really did, but the more time had prolonged the more my vision had became more sinister. All the tree’s had seemed to become more gnarled, the white snow around had turned black or red and the man that was once defined had became a silhouette with the red blood the only color of it.

I honestly was thinking of going for my gun and shooting myself when my vision was broken by another figure that was defined, I can’t remember who it was, but I had relief to my mind, heart, and soul that person came. He clashed with the other person head on and just yelled,
“Run Murphy run!” He kicked the other person and both were in a stand-off with blades. I could move my legs again and I did what the man told me to, I just ran…I ran…and I ran…Until I realized something.
“This place…” I remembered now “This mission…That man…This was the day that…” I looked back and I could still somehow hear the clash of blades that were far off in the distance “No…I want to run, but that man was…I…”
“Run!” His words echoed in my ears. I was overflowed with regret and indecisiveness, I didn’t know what I should’ve done on that fateful day, and it was either to run or save my best friend…To live to see another day or a possible death be in vain…Thus on that very moment…
121332111.title: Freezing shadows

1213321112.content:
I turned back and ran toward my best friends’ location. I’m sorry Tom, but I just can’t let my best friend handle that monster alone, seriously, you helped me one to many times, it would hurt me more if I ran once more, especially with that person. Even if both of us would fall together in battle…at the very least…

When I entered the clearing I saw Tom all kinds of messed up with his arms, legs…heck his entire body looked like he went through a grinder, and the man he fought didn’t even have a single scratch on him. Tom had looked back to see me raise my gun at the enemy. At that one moment in time, everything seemed to have slowed down, I could see my buddy mouth something which I couldn’t hear as I fired my gun…but whatever that man was…he truly was a monster as he just seemingly disappeared into the snow itself as I looked around to see where I went until I felt something being jabbed through my back and out my chest.

I dropped my gun in reaction to the knife going through my chest which immediately came right out and I was slashed across behind me knees and then my back in quick succession, I fell to the ground. Tom yelled in anger as he charged the man only to get easily taken out and he dropped near my position, heck, we were facing each other in our screwed up conditions.
“The strong protect the weak” The enemy said with a heavy Russian-like accent “The weak tried to protect the strong…As respect to a brave, maybe loyal fool, I will leave you two alone to speak your prayers to your gods and to each other and may both of your get out of this hell and into heaven” He walked away and us two were left staring at each other with Tom glaring at me with a lot of anger,
“You idiot! Why didn’t you run like I told you too?!” He yelled and I chuckled,
“Because, I wasn’t about to leave my best friend alone to a monster” I smiled at the predicament both of us were in
“Shit man, we really are going to die here”
“Isn’t that what we signed up for?” I joked half heartedly
“If I can move my arms I would punch you right now”
“Hey Tom, what would be your regret before we go to wherever?”
“That I didn’t bang your hot sister when I got the chance!” He joked as both of us laughed rather weakly while coughing up blood
“My regret would’ve been leaving my friends behind whenever I feared something, but this time, I didn’t” He grabbed Tom’s hand “From here, from this point, we both fell in battle…at the very least…” There was a bright light before I could even finish “We died like brothers…” From the light there was darkness, those last words echoed through the dark abyss and then came a white light that had appeared.

I woke up again, but this time instead of an infirmary it was in some sort of bedroom which was like any other. In the bedroom, Tom was standing by the window where he was just looking at the sunny sky while holding a small box in his hand. When I got out of bed I headed toward the door and before I could turn the knob Tom turned his head to the side and only said,
“You know Murphy, my only regret was not being able to go back alive and give your older sister a ring…but at least you lived, that is all that mattered, whatever would've made her happy would make me happy as well, and so...” He lowered his head and looked out the window again "I guess it's farewell for now...Murphy, no matter what, hang on to your life, it's precious for everyone" He slowly faded out of existence as on the windowsill was a open black box with a glistening ring in the sunlight. I approached it and carefully grabbed it, but then it turned into...well I have no idea what happened since it just dematerialized into balls of light that also disappeared soon after. I just went toward the door, ignoring what just happened, opened it and another bright light had engulfed me. Wherever I went to next, I just had to get out...
1213321112.title: Brothers in arms

12133211121.content:
I blinked once and my vision wouldn’t regain its original form. I blinked again and only saw silhouettes.
“We are all going to die aren’t we?” One disembodied voice questioned as the sounds of a vehicle running came into my senses
“Just hide behind the ‘special forces’ that were sent to take care of those monsters” Another voice said as my vision had returned to the real world. I found myself sitting in the back of a tactical jeep and my head was leaning against a female soldier
“Awake yet sleeping beauty?” She questioned as I got my head off her shoulder “If you aren’t that might as well be your last”
“Leave him alone Skully” One of the soldiers at the front said and the female soldier was pissed off
“Oy! Just because his last name is Mulder doesn’t give you the right to-“
“Well then ‘Skully’ just stop shooting everyone in the head!” One of the soldiers joked as I tried to figure out what was beyond the windshield which there was nothing but light
“Where are we going?” I questioned as ‘Skully’ went into the mounted machine gun up top
“We are reinforcements” Then the driver yelled something incoherent as the light enveloped us all…

I blinked again and found myself sitting on some sort of bed as I looked up to a concrete ceiling and that I was wearing a gasmask
“What the hell?” I questioned as I sat up and looked around to where I was, which looked like a prison cell “What is this?” When I tried to stand up a pain shot up from my right leg. I looked down to see my pant leg torn and covered with bandages. Then all of a sudden a loud static sound went through my ears and I covered them to no avail of blocking it. All I heard was incoherent screaming, guns firing, and the sounds of something inhumane along with the distinct sound of flesh tearing and bones breaking, something I know far too well. When I uncapped my hands I limped out into the open to get a bearing of my position.

When I went out, it didn’t seem like I wasn’t in a prison per se, but more like a holding area for people being disruptive as there was just a desk, some decoration, and a steel door. I checked around the area and found it bare of any information of where I could possibly be and I couldn’t find anything as a crutch which was going to be annoying. With this lack of information, something dawned a question on me,
“If this is all part of my memory, then which mission was this?” When I was approaching the door I was suddenly hit with another auditory memory fragment,
“No matter what, no matter what you hear, just do not get out of the room, understand?” I leaned upon the door and griped the door knob and thought,
“Damn it, what the hell was this mission again? What was out there? What did I do last time?” Contemplating upon a decision without any type of available information, I just decided to….

13.content:
A place where you can roam the land and fight ranked individuals, get stronger and move up in the rankings.

Basic template for new character: Name, age, gender, nationality, description, weapon specialty, special (The special basically summarizes what they do, overall. Optional to insert a move-set), backstory/story etc...

Also, for inspiration:

-Walking armory: Person that carries a giant inventory of weapons/equipments
-Human-weapon: People who were experimented on for military purposes and are now either roaming free or condemned
-Esper: People with supernatural abilities such as pyrokinesis, telekinesis, electrokinesis. Other abilities include magnetism and invisibility. Please note that, although supernatural, in some places in this world, this had become a science so people could gain abilities from their potential.
-Grand (Insert class here), a grand (insert class here) are considered to be the 'super' of their regular counterparts such as grand hunters and grand swordsman. Quite a few ranked people are these.

Also note that being in the rankings is just a formality, it is not exactly necessary, you can just make a character, and start a war with these guys (With or against, I don't care, but that might be a bad idea)

131.content:
Name: Irie Shizu
Age: 27
Gender: male
Nationality: Japanese
Description: Average height, slim, black medium length hair, black eyes, white. Wearing long-sleeve green shirt, black pants, and black shoes. Also has a backpack which is filled with different stuff from emergency supplies to a flare gun.
Weapon: Katana (Strong enough to withstand bullets without denting)
Special: A master swordsman. Has extremely advanced hand-eye coordination and movement, enabling the ability to actually block bullets and he also can refract light with his katana and cause a sudden flash of light, confusing and blinding his opponents. He is also a beast master, a person who has massive experience with all types and kinds of animals.
Fact: He really has been around the world and so there is a high chance he may know certain people in the Rankings...or at least people who know them.

Side-Note: He has a white wolf companion named Sora...and he can talk...well why the heck not?

Story: Shizu is what you would consider either a wanderer or a nomad that had first went on his journey when his mother died when he was at a young age and his father can be easily described as the biggest douche that has ever lived. As a child to adulthood he has been through many hardships, encountered people of many types, and been through many places and have learned from all of that and gained much experience. Mid-way he had met his companion in a forest that had significant mystical powers AKA It looked incredibly insane and beautiful. In that forest did one giant plot event happened which I don't want to mention here. Another thing to know is that, although he was taught about the 'rules of vengeance' he still went on to have revenge on his father, which someone had already done it for him. Following him now, he rides in a dune buggy with his companion and just rides where ever the non-existent road takes him...which it leads up to the top of a giant mountain.
131.title: Wandering Blademaster

1311.content:
A man in an all-grey casual outfit and a wooden mask is walking through a combat-university type school with a teenage Shizu wearing normal clothing and a katana by his side.
"This world of ours...it's quite interesting, isn't it?" Shizu said
"A lot of things happened in the past that have led to these types of days...where the weak grow strong and strong grow even stronger" The grey-man replied
"Exactly...a lot did happen, right?"
"I lived through it, fought through it, and it was a changing experience in more ways than one"
"And I saw the aftermath of it all, the changes that had occurred...Somehow I can't believe that all of those events had brought out certain people's potential"
"For some of them, I brought out their strength...quite a shame some of it went to waste"
"How, when they strayed from the path you tried to make them avoid?"
"No...When some couldn't see beyond the surface, when they heard only what they wanted to hear, and they let their actions speak of nothing more than mindless emotions flaring..." While he said that there were several loud explosions outside
"So...J...mind telling me why you wear that wooden mask?"
"It's just a reminder of the past....that's all I have to say for now"
"So...why do you fight?"
"I should be asking you that...The reason I fight is to point people in the right path, but as you can see from other's that seems to be human nature to go what their heart says, not what morals say...to each their own I guess"
"The real reason J...don't mask the reason like you hide your past"
"I'm not hiding the past, I am embracing it, this is just a reminder of it"
"So, why do you always hold-back?"
"..." While he was remaining silent, a student went flying through the wall and another student came and picked him up to continue whatever they were doing.
"You aren't answering me"
"I fight with all my heart when I know someone is strong, they have a higher chance of survival, I know nothing about holding back nor restraint, even so, I am still a feared opponent when I hold back, that is how strong I am"
"So...when do we begin?"
"After I know the reason why you fight"
"Of course...my reason to fight is..." While he was thinking a spear came flying through the wall.
"Can't think of one? Give me one after you find your inner strength and you can see beyond what is there" He then pulled out one of his knives and Shizu unsheathed his katana. They charged at each other and clashed blades...

*Insert scene of Shizu fighting Ranked 101: Jerry Jenkins...and losing miserably*

Years later...

Morning was starting as Shizu drove up at the front of the combat school in his dune buggy with Sora (His white wolf companion) in the back.
"It's been a long time since I've been here" Shizu said as he got out of his vehicle, taking Sora with him
"This place bring any good memories?" Sora asked while both of them went through the school door's
"Well, I remember the first time I met Jenkins and what came after that..."
"So, anything good?"
"Nope...it was hell" After he said that, a spear came flying through the wall "Some things never change" Then they entered the courtyard where in the middle was Jerry Jenkins sitting at the fountain throwing a knife into the air and catching it.
"Shizu Irie, it's been a while" Jenkins said as sheathed his knife
"Yes it has Sensei Jenkins"
"Quit it with the formalities...whose the wolf?"
"I'm Sora, his companion"
"Okay a talking wolf...haven't seen that yet...So, you have an answer to that question I asked?"
"You still remember that?...The reason I fight...is so that I can see the people that live in this interesting world, how they see it and then see beyond it, what they hear and see how they interpret it, and see their actions to know what they feel...that is why I fight"
"That is quite a reason, okay then Shizu, after all of these years, let's see if you have what it takes to see the people of the world without dying" He stood up from his place and disappeared in a cloud of grey smoke...

This chapter of the storybook had just begun.
1311.title: past and future

13111.content:
Immediately after his disappearance, Shizu unsheathed his Katana and ran toward a place that is not as open as the courtyard as Sora ran in another direction. While he was running towards cover, several shurikens and kunai came flying out of various cover spots. With great skill he managed to block most of the projectiles as the others missed their mark. He continued running until he reached the doors to a large building and when he tried to open them it turned out it was locked. In a hurry, he kicked them open, went in, and immediately closed the door behind him to hear the sounds of blades hitting the side of the door. As he checked the area he saw that he was in the gymnasium and that Jerry was laying down on the closed bleachers, throwing and catching a knife.
"Well, its good to know that you are in shape and that your reflexes are sharp as ever" He caught his knife, stood up, and cracked his neck "Well, with that throwing exercise done, time to do some cardio" He jumped from the bleachers and when he landed on his feet he moved with great speed and charged at Shizu, who was in a solid stance.

While Jerry was almost near Shizu, he shifted his blade in such a position that the light shining on it was magnified, causing a sudden flash of light, blinding Jerry and giving Shizu an opening to attack. When his blade was about to hit Jerry's abdomen, he suddenly jerked away and avoided it. Then the two were locked into a blade fight with 1 Katana against 2 daggers. While both of them were skillfully blocked and parrying each other, Shizu noticed something about Jerry's eye's,
"You can fight with your eyes closed?" He questioned as Jenkins broke his defense and managed to stick a knife into his left shoulder. Even with the blade in him, he still continued to fight with his right arm.
"Sometimes, the thing that will betray you the most is your very own sight..."

While they were still fighting, Shizu suddenly stumbled and felt his vision getting blurry. He dropped his Katana and held his head, trying to figure out what was going on, thankfully Jenkins had temporarily stopped and started to explain what was going on,
"You know, you are getting off easy..." Shizu was then on the ground, vomiting and suffering from nausea "If this were the real me, you would have been killed the minute the match started...Shizu, you are strong, but this path you are about to take is going to kill you, as, not only are there 100 more after me, but you are going to face the other original 9 and then face the 10 who beat the originals" After he finished vomiting and regained some composure, he reached into his backpack and took out a syringe and injected himself with it "I admire your persistence and willpower, but that is not all you need. The ability to open your eyes, open your mind, to truly see what is really there in front of you is something" Shizu got up and picked up his Katana and prepared to fight once more.
"S-...Jerry, you really stop having long monologues"
"And why is that?" He questioned as he pulled out another dagger that became electrified
"It can give people time to prepare!" From a conveniently opened gym door that led to the hallways, Sora was running very quickly with a sword in his mouth and charged at Jenkins, who seemed to have been expected him as he immediately turned and kicked to the side, but not without leaving him open to attack as Shizu moved incredibly fast to manage to cut Jerry's back and then he moved out of the way to regroup with Sora. Though with such a large wound, Jerry did not react to it, but he was impressed enough to clap his hands together
"Ah, good teamwork, also Shizu, sorry for underestimating you, I didn't think you were able to even move that fast and you even managed to wound me that much which many fail to do, even with a machine-gun or even in a firing squad"

He took off his grey casual outfit and threw it into the air (With wooden mask still on) and what lay under that was that he had many scars, a tactical vest and many ammo-pockets strapped to his legs,
"Remember how I am known to hold back unless the opponent I have is VERY strong?"
"Yes I do" Shizu replied as both him and Sora prepared for the worst.
"Well...I'm still holding back" Suddenly all the pockets that he opened up and, with great dexterity, he pulled out various thrown, bladed weapons and threw a storm of them (Which is no exaggeration) Among the blades were those that were poisoned, electrified, and even exploding and with the giant storm that was headed for them, they did something most people would do.
"Run unless you want to become a human target dummy!" Sora yelled as he was well ahead of Shizu, not for being a wolf, but because he was running before Jenkins pulled out his blade storm. Both of them went outside, closed the door, and continued to run as the gymnasium doors exploded and more blades continues to fly after them. Both of them split up again to avoid the blades and instead of them getting hit, it was the fountain that got destroyed and the building opposite of the gymnasium which was going to need serious renovation later. Both of them had regrouped in the middle of the courtyard and looked around to see where Jenkins is,
"Sora, you smell him?" Shizu questioned as he pulled another syringe from his bag and injected himself with it
"I don't smell him anywhere, I don't think-" Suddenly Jenkins had dropped in between them and fought both with them even though they were opposite sides of each other. Despite this fact, he was still holding his own as his defense was still going strong and he was handling the two of them quite well.
"Damn!" Shizu thought "He is far stronger than I had anticipated, how is this monster of a man originally the 10th strongest?! What's worse is that he is holding back...What can I do?" That was when Shizu started to have feeling in his left arm again "I know it's far-fetched, but..." Suddenly at the right time, both Sora and Shizu had a blade lock on Jenkins, which gave the perfect opening to attack. With great dexterity, Shizu placed his katana in his left hand and pulled the poisoned blade from his shoulder and proceeded to attempt a stab at Jenkins' arm.

Jenkins immediately noticed this and he got out of his blade lock on both of them and had kicked the poisoned blade out of Shizu's hand up into the air. As it seemed it was going to be another long blade-fight, Sora had released his blade and bit Jenkins in the leg as Shizu pushed him over. Just as he was about to get up, the knife that was kicked into the air was now being held to his throat by Shizu,
"Do you surrender Jenkins?" Jenkins was thinking while staring down at the blade by his throat
"3 things: I'm tired from throwing all those blades, I think my wound is infected, and I think poison directly applied to my throat is going to suck a lot, so...It appears I lose" Shizu got off of him. He then offered a hand to assist Jenkins up, but he declined as he got himself up. Both of them shook hands for a fight well-fought
"Well, congratulations on managing to win against me" Jenkins said as he probed his wounded back
"I thank Sora for the win, by the way, thanks buddy"
"This guy had an odd taste when I bit him" Sora replied
"Well, let's talk the rest while we heal up in the infirmary" While all 3 were walking towards the medical wing, Jenkins stopped "Oh and for the finale, say your farewell to the fans"
"What fan-" Then suddenly screams of energy were heard and Shizu looked up to see that there were people on the rooftops and upper-floors of the buildings who seemed to have been watching the entire time "Wait how long have they been up there?"
"Shizu, you really didn't noticed them when the battle started?" Sora questioned
"I was too busy fighting the deadliest person that has ever lived to even notice"
--------

#101: Jerry Jenkins

#101: Shizu Irie
"Wow, didn't expect the grey shadow-killer to lose...well it appears my job is done"
13111.title: Wolf and Dagger

131111.content:
Shizu, Jenkins, and Sora were all in the same room, with all of them being separated by hospital curtains and the fact that Sora is far away from the two of them, being examined by the school nurses and were all being examined and being treated for their wounds. While they were doing that, Shizu and Jenkins were talking and the school went back to its original pace which was the continuous sounds of fighting and mayhem that was occurring outside.
"Jenkins" Shizu started "What are you going to do, now that you are no longer apart of the 101?"
"It's just a title" He replied "Though it holds some significance, I would still be regarded for my other title and I'm still going to teach" After he said that a nurse poured some sort of liquid on his back and there was a very distinct sizzling sound and even vapor coming out "Nurse, I think whatever stuff you put on me was too strong because it feels like someone is burning me alive, I should know" The nurse excused herself to get something to alleviate the burning sensation as they got back to talking "So, what are you going to do next?"
"Well, I'm going to continue on forward until I hit a wall...unless that wall has a crack I'll break it down"
"Good enough answer"
"Jenkins, before I leave, what should I be aware of?"
"Besides dying, that some of these people are ridiculously powerful, and some of them are psychotic? Well, I can give you an info dump, would that suffice?"
"Sure, just as long as it's not long winded like your monologs"
"Battling 101 started off as a group of 10 people who were supposed to be the ones sent out to take on forces far greater than any person. After the events that transpired the battling 101 became more of a competition, though the function of a attack force still stands to today. Of the original 10, they essentially became scrub filters so not just anyone could join or get through the rankings easily, though this was set after the competition was over. Want to know more?"
"Still long-winded, but good to know...so where in the world is the next guy?"
"Wait you didn't even-"
"Hey, I am always on the move and I ride a dune buggy"
"Why didn't you get an RV?"
"...Beside the point"
"Wait you had to defeat a high-level courier, didn't those guys give you any kind of instructions or where about of everyone?"
"No, that guy just told me to go here and all will be explained later"
"Wait who the heck did you-"
"Um...that guy was-" Then suddenly a smoke bomb was detonated and covered the entire room. After the smoke cleared there was a canister on Shizu's lap. When he checked what was inside it was a note that simply said "I'll just take you there" "Well I think that just answered my question"
"Well, good luck on your adventure...oh by the way, take this" He pulled out several green vials "These will aid you in subduing people who you don't want to kill, I will guess you will use these a lot" Shizu took them and placed them in his bag
"Thanks, this will help a lot...oh and by the way, nurse?" One of the nurses poked their head out between the hospital curtains
"Yes?"
"Am I free to leave now?" The nurse brought out her clipboard to checked
"Yeah you are, just as long as you don't do anything extreme...which I'll assume you are going to do anyway"
"So" Jenkins stated "What about me?"
"You are definitely staying here sir"
"I'm fine with that"
"So, what about Sora?"
"The white wolf?...He's just fine, but one of our nurses seemed to have been...attached to him"
"Wait, how did that-" Shizu listened closer to what was going around him and...well
"Em...Let go of me please!" Sora screamed as there was some sounds of a struggle
"Aw, can't you stay a little longer?!" One of the nurses said in a pleading tone
"No! I'm fine! Shizu help me out here!"
"You know my rule about getting in the way of love!"
"Ah! You traitor!"
"Not traitor, remember that psycho stalker chick?" There was a slight awkward silence after that question "Yeah, not doing that again!" After that Sora whined as there was a distinct chuckle coming from the nurse on him.

After that moment passed Shizu and Sora were walking out of the combat school in the afternoon
"Wow, time flies by fast" Shizu said as he got into the driver seat of his dune buggy
"Yeah and so does friendship" Sora said as he got into the back "So, where are we headed?"
"Honestly, I have no clue. I guess we wait until we get information by whatever courier meet's us next" Suddenly a smoke bomb was detonated "Well speak of the devil" After the smoke cleared there was someone standing in front of the dune buggy. The one standing in front of it was a darkened-skinned female with a black tied ponytail wearing brown rugged garb with brown shoes, gloves, cap with goggles on top of it. She also had a black rapier strapped on her left and a brown strapped bag on her right.
"Yo" She greeted as she got into the front seat of the dune buggy
"...Uh" Shizu said as the woman brought her hand out and Shizu shaked it
"Name's River, I'm the courier that will guide you to the others"
"Okay...So where are we headed?"
"Canada"
"Canada?" Shizu was maintaining a calm tone
"We don't lie about ranked people's location"
"Why the heck can't I get the guy over to my location?"
"The rules say so"
"Ah! So why can't I get a lift over there?"
"Eh...You can...but I don't have the clearance for that"
"What kind of screwball-"
"Ah, but don't worry, there is some good things about winning against a ranked member"
"Such as?"
"Did you know that if you defeat a ranked member you can actually win an award?"
"Oh, you mean something like this?" Shizu pulled the poison vials he got from Jenkins
"Not what I meant!" She pulled out some sort of electronic device from her bag, messed with it a little, and showed the screen in front of his face
"Whoa, that's a lot of money"
"Well, you are fighting the stronger fighters in the world, plus that was originally the 10th strongest so the reward is even greater. Oh and for future reference you can't grind money from members weaker than you...Also foreign currency adjustment available"
"That's good and all, but besides showing me the amount of money I have, what other purpose was that for?"
"To get an RV"
"Huh? Why me?"
"Because you're the one with the money, I'm the one guiding you, and this dune buggy smells like death rolled over it several times"
"Technically death did do that and second and I really don't want to get rid of this dune buggy, it has sentimental value"
"Bah, you know that we have a special storage system so we can keep your things so you don't have to get rid of it"
"Oh that's good...do you even know where we can procure an RV?"
"Yeah I do, now lets go, we are burning daylight, let's hit the road swordsman!" River yelled as Shizu hit the gas and they were riding towards the location of where the RV was...which it just so happened the sun was setting in that direction.
"What the hell did I get myself into?" Shizu thought

And the ride to Canada begins...

*While in the infirmary*
"Hm...Damn it!" Jenkins said as a nurse was applying a substance on his back
"What is it?"
"I forgot to say something to Shizu, during the rank numbering there were some people who actually forfeited mid-way and that the next person he is about to fight is one of these people"
"What is the significance of that?"
"The person he is fighting next is a literal powerhouse that defeated 50 of my students in under 5 minutes..."
131111.title: Blood bags and bandages

1311111.content:
-While on the way to Canada-

The RV that they had procured was simple in design and wasn't anything spectacular, but it got the job done and it was comfortable. Currently it was daytime and Shizu was driving with Sora still sleeping and River wide awake and checking something on her cellphone,
"Hey River" Shizu said
"Yes?" She replied
"Besides being my guide, why are you tagging along with me? I know there is an ulterior motive besides this"
"Well, it is usually a requirement for a ranked member to have at least 1 courier watching them so that when they are defeated it is confirmed, but there are a few exceptions, for example there is a man who can delete a person's memory just by encountering him, another who is living in deep, underground disparity of the aftermath of war, and also these two beings who are in another dimension"
"Wait what"
"So for those people you need a certain item from them to even pass their rank"
"Wait how did you even get those people involved or even recorded if one deletes memories and the others are either living in hell itself or another dimension?!"
"There are several ways, one would be our advanced information system and second would be that the memory eraser left his calling card"
"So how exactly did they enter?"
"Not all of the ranked individuals got through the tournament process, very few were placed in their respected area's based on observations of their power and theoretical battle results"
"Doesn't that seem unfair?"
"Oh, so you want to fight a person that can bend space and time and another who can null all supernatural forces and control nothingness?"
"Fair point...How exactly did these people join in the first place?"
"It was of their own accord, heck if I know what they were thinking"
"By chance can you assist me in battle?
"Depending on the situation"
"Good to know"

This was the entire trip in a nutshell: Talk, pitstop, random assist missions, and random bandit attacks...Yeah that went well.

-Several days later-

It was about nighttime when they had reached their destination...
"We there yet?" Sora questioned as he was in the front seat with Shizu
"Well" Shizu started "It's snowy, there are pine tree's everywhere, and I think that is the Canadian flag right over there, yeah I'm sure we're there...wait are we?"
"Yup, we're definitely here" River responded as the RV stopped at a café
"I think we should take a quick break before we go looking for ranked 100" As they all got out and entered the café there weren't that many people, but what was apparent was that these people didn't seem like your average Canadians as most of them had bladed rifles of sorts while others had some assorted weaponry that seemed foreign. What made the atmosphere heavier was that the minute they entered everyone, like any other time someone new enters, they were all staring at the 3 of them. Though it didn't take long for every to go back to what they were doing, it still was tense. When Shizu and River sat down and ordered something hot, Sora got a bone, though normally he would be slightly peeved at that...
"Maple syrup flavored bone? I'm not complaining" Funny enough, although the wolf talking was loud and clear no one gave an eye about it which normally they would. While Shizu and River were drinking their coffee and eating misc. food, they decided to chat once more.
"Not so happy-go-lucky, isn't it?" Shizu questioned as he took a bite out of his food
"Considering what happened in this town, I wouldn't be surprised"
"Let me here the story, it may give me a bead on who the person I'm fighting is"
"You know I could've give you his statistics if you would've asked"
"I don't mean how he fights, I meant I would get an idea on how this person works"
"Okay...this is what happened in this town..."

-Abandoned power station-

A man wearing full-rubber rain gear was twirling a metal pole around with high amounts of skill and was contemplating his next actions
"So...after several years someone actually defeated Jerry Jenkins...That man really peeves me off with how much he holds back, but..." He stopped twirling and stabbed the ground with his pole and a giant flow of electricity coursed through it and suddenly the entire station seemed to be running again with the snow melting around it "Considering it all, I would love to see how this person fights and see if he is really worthy of being called ranked, and to do that..." He negated the electrical flow going through his pole and the power station suddenly turned off, but not without water being everywhere "Let's see how you handle unfair environmental conditions" A spark of electricity came from this man's head as he walked to the place where he is going to wait.
1311111.title: The road to infodumping

13111111.content:
After a long winded story that could have easily taken all night, Shizu pretty much summarized all of it,
"So Leo Branchurias pretty much saved all of Canada by taking on the main base of the Canadian branch of a giant international gang called arbor sangrientos, which was this town, which caused a giant domino effect that crippled all of the gang's power in Canada, all by himself?"
"That pretty much sums it up"
"You should've just said that from the start, because I think Sora fell asleep from that" He checked on Sora and found out he actually did fell asleep with a bone still in his mouth "Yeah you actually bored him to sleep"
"So, why did you want to know the story?"
"To fight your enemy, you know your enemy, I may know what he is fighting for, but I really don't know anything about him until I see how he fights and also..." He placed his backpack on top of the and rummaged through it and pulled out a syringe "Since he is such a literal powerhouse, I think this may help"
"Sorry for asking, but why do you carry so many syringes and where did you get them from?"
"Well, I got it from various people I encountered in the past and these things have been useful, but lately I've been running low"
"So what does that do?" Shizu injected himself with it "You'll see, by the way it's about time we leave" He paid the bill, woke Sora up, and all 3 were headed toward the door when one of the men in the café stood in the way,
"Hold it" He said and all 3 stopped "I heard your conversation about the hero and the gang he took down, listen, I have one thing to say"
"We're listening" Shizu replied
"There are still remnants of that gang that still want revenge after many years for their lost comrades and purpose, so watch yourself, they may not anyone get in the way of their vengeance or they may pick up the scraps after your fight" He got out of the way of the entrance "Sorry for taking up your time" When Sora and River were heading for the RV, Shizu stopped right at the door frame
"By chance, were you-"
"Part of the gang? Yes...we all were, we were the people who decided to live our lives differently after that man let us decided to choose our own path"
"It's unfortunate that there are some people that are blinded by what is in front of them and let themselves play a ballad that ends abruptly or is played poorly with broken strings"
"Indeed...You know, you're aren't half-bad of a person even though this conversation lasted about a minute"
"We are both people who can see with our mind, not our sight, and know what is needed and what is not...Well, see you later"
"Right after you beat the hero of Canada, drinks are on me"
"I don't drink" After he said that the man chuckled and Shizu drove to the location of the next fight...

After a few minutes wandering around in darkness and snow they managed to get to the very sizeable abandoned power station which was right outside of the outskirts of the town. The RV was parked right outside and after an observation it was clear that no one had used it in years as it was worn and torn down with the chain-link fences all smashed to high-heaven, the transformers all appearing to be busted and other metallic things frosted over. But the strange thing is that, despite it being very cold there were traces of snow being recently melted, indicated by the surrounding puddles and dripping icicles.
"Sora, River, both of you stay here" Shizu said as he brought out a syringe and inserted it into his arm
"I can understand River, Shizu, but why me?" Sora questioned as he ran back inside the RV to get his sword
"Because, I don't want you getting fried from the inside, also you two, keep an eye out for those gang members, they may arrive"
"You don't have to worry about both of us" River responded "I'm pretty sure both of us are capable of handling just a few gang remnants"
"Don't get cocky now"
"Hey I think I should be saying that to you, now don't die on the second person you fight next, you hear!?" Shizu walked through the broken fence and into the large power station
"I didn't come here to die"

Shizu was walking through the maze of a power-station with a high-grade flashlight strapped to his waist and a Katana out and ready just in case. While he was walking he heard the sound of electricity crackling and when he turned around he saw a tall, white man with blonde hair, wearing goggles, a rubber suit that was better suited for rain rather than the cold, with a metal pole and a L-pipe with a valve at the bend strapped to his back, on top of a metal frame.
"Ah, so you must be the man that defeated Jenkins" He said as he jumped down onto a giant puddle of water "Now, let's see if you have what it means to be ranked!" He removed his gloves and grabbed his metal pole, which became electrified, and he placed it forcibly into the ground and suddenly the entire powerstation seemed to have came to life with the lights also coming back on. "It wouldn't be fun to fight in the dark, now would it?"
"Before we pound each other into electrical ions, what is your purpose?" Shizu questioned as he got into a fighting stance
"With what I heard from other's, you can tell or make assumptions based on how people can fight...and so, with that..." He held the pole in his hands like a sword "I'll tell you once I have been beaten!" He charged at Shizu, which when he swung, Shizu dodged it easily and had swung his blade at Leo's legs to get him to hinder him quickly, but that is where he discovers something,
"My sword didn't even cut through his pants!" He thought as he retreated as Leo swung again. As he was at a fair-distance away, he heard Leo laugh a little,
"Surprised? My gear is not only keeping electricity in, but it is also reinforced" He slung his pole over his shoulder "Also, a tid-bit, if your sword stabs through my armor, prepare to get shocked by the electricity that literally runs through my veins!" The second he finished he grabbed his pipe and aimed it at Shizu. Electricity flowed through it quickly as focused orbs of electricity were shot out of it...
13111111.title: Story and redemption

131111111.content:
The orbs of electricity were easy to dodge, but the real problem was the amount of water that covered the uneven ground. Though there were a few dry spots, the amount of water far outweighed that and it would be a bad idea to use the metal framing to get an edge on Leo as metal conducts electricity. There was also the dim lighting which using his light refraction would be not be as effective and even if he were to do is successfully, Leo's goggles may just block most of it. The only things going for him were not only his speed, but also...
"You know you're in a tight spot, eh?" Leo questioned as he stopped firing and aimed at the ground while adjusting the valve on the pipe "What are you going to do now?"
"I'm going to recklessly attack you until I slash your armor off"
"Wait what-" Shizu charged at Leo with high amounts of speed which didn't surprise Leo much as he fired into the puddle of water, which before he fired Shizu jumped into the air and slashed him across the chest, again didn't even break through it, which made Leo stumble slightly, but before he could recover Shizu kept slashing him quickly, seemingly giving no room to even counter-attack, but then Leo fired his pipe again which was directed at Shizu which at that distance he didn't miss and it made full contact at high power. Shizu was stunned and knocked-back by it which Leo pulled out his pole and started to beat the living crap out of him which the electricity added more internal damage.

After multiple punishing combo attacks, he slammed Shizu down onto the ground with his pole directly on his chest, which where he had been forced against was the largest concentration of water around the area. He went heavily on the electrical output and a giant release of electricity was unleashed through his pole. The amount of electricity that flowed was so high that the lights were overloaded and the light bulbs exploded and some of the surrounding transformers blew up. After he was finished, Leo was breathing heavily and was checking Shizu's body, which he either assumed he was unconscious or half-dead.
"Ah, it appears you weren't fit to be ranked in the first place. I despise people who think the battling 101 is a cool trend or game and think it's easy to enter...well it's not" He slung his pole around his shoulder and was walking away from Shizu "You know you weren't half-bad, but next time think about your actions before you do something stupid" Leo checked his gear "Damn you really banged up my armor" That was when he heard something behind him. When he looked behind him he saw Shizu getting up "What?! Impossible! How are you still able to-"
"Because" Shizu stated as he fully got up and pointed his katana at Leo "Before I got in here I injected myself with two doses of liquid insulation"
"Liquid insulation? What the heck is that?"
"Liquid insulation, not much know about it, but liquid insulation is a type of chemical one can put into themselves to give them either higher heat resistance or electrical resistance. Thankfully it hardly does any damage to your body, but it is temporary"
"So that explains it...Ah ha ha ha ha" Leo was laughing after that "Jeez, and here I thought I was facing a weakling, guess I underestimated you...now" Leo removed his gear and what was remaining was a man wearing nothing but green shorts and a white shirt. Due to the lack of light the only thing that could be seen fully is the constant small electrical discharges around his body and his blue eyes "Even with your higher electrical resistance, there is a limit!" Leo pulled out his pole and suddenly a large amount of electricity was unleashed which provided enough light to easily see, also Leo just looked very amazing yet intimidating at the same time. Both of them got into a fighting stance and then charged at each other. When they clashed steel, a giant discharge of electricity was unleashed causing one giant electrical lightshow, which again it looked ridiculously awesome.

-Outside of power station-

There were several bodies laid out all across the ground as River was stealing their weapons and Sora was looking back at the power station
"Man, a lot of electricity flowing through that place" He said as he looked back at River "Why are you doing that?"
"Selling these weapons for a quick buck...or scrapping them for spare parts depending on how much they sell"
"I can see logic in that" That was when, from their point of view, a giant electrical discharge was unleashed and it even reached as far as where they were at "What in the world?!"
"Ah, I see that Leo removed is limiting gear...well time to prepare a letter of resignation, by an untimely death"
"Have faith in Shizu, he doesn't die easily"
"Considering he got Leo to remove his gear, I guess so"

-Now back inside-

Both Shizu and Leo were still holding their ground in a weapons lock as electricity continuously flowed everywhere
"You're a tough one aren't you?" Leo questioned
"Well I have to be since it's now more brawns than brains since about half my brain cells got killed" Shizu responded
"Ha, laughing in the face of death I see...Let's end this, with this amount of staring you'd think we were on a date"
"Agreed" Shizu broke Leo's defense as both of them were in a giant game of blocking and breaking, with Shizu outclassing Leo in breaking his defense with the amount of times he had cut him. At the final blow, Shizu launched Leo's pole into the air and impaled him through the abdomen where a giant flow of electricity flowed through his blade and electrocuted him far above what his insulation could handle.

After that moment both Shizu and Leo fell to the ground with Leo on his side and Shizu on his back. Both were still conscious and severely injured
"Congratulations" Leo said "You beat me...you are deserving of being ranked"
"So Leo...Tell me if I'm right. From what I can see, the reason you fight is to make sure the weak don't try to do what the strong do, am I right?"
"Tch, that about sums it up. Although it's good that the weak try to help, but it's the strong that are supposed to help them. For the weak to help would mean the strong aren't strong enough to do anything or that the weak are people with strong will that would fight to the bitter end to reach their goals, which is admirable"
"But even so, willpower isn't everything"
"You got that right...Hey Shizu"
"What?"
"Why the hell did you impale this sword through me and why didn't you pull it out?"
"To defeat you and so that you don't bleed out, which speaking of..." He got back up and was about to pull the blade out of Leo when someone grabbed his shoulder. He looked behind him and saw that it was the man from the café
"Hold on, I got this..."

-Few hours later...At the café, at morning-

While Shizu was in the café speaking to the unnamed man and Leo, Sora and River were in the RV doing their own thing,
"So you're the courier that watches Leo?" Shizu questioned the man
"Yes I am" He replied
"So Leo, what are you going to do now?"
"Well, Since the 10th barrier is now gone I am going to do my purpose of fighting"
"Well that's good...by the way how's your wound?"
"Shizu, I'm pretty sure you received more damage than me"
"That's true, but I have to be strong enough to get through the rankings so it shouldn't be a problem"
"Are you mocking me? Because that was electricity I hit you with, toughness doesn't do crap against that!"
"Well, see you later, it was a pleasure fighting you" When Shizu was walking out the unnamed courier stopped him
"Hold on, you forgot something" Shizu turned around and caught a bottle of alcohol "Didn't I say when you beat Leo, drinks are on me?"
"Like I said, I don't drink" Shizu took the bottle anyway and was about to leave when Leo said something
"And Shizu...Don't die easily, I don't want to know the person that beat me was weak" While Shizu was walking toward the RV, he just waved back.

When he entered the RV, River immediately showed him the next destination,
"The Mexican border? Are you kidding me?"
"Couriers don't lie"
"We're in Canada, that's in Mexico, why can't we get an air-lift over there?"
"Like I said, I don't have clearance" Shizu got in the drivers seat and face-palmed onto the car horn "It's a good thing we traveled many times before...and River"
"Yes?"
"When are you going to remove all these guns?" Shizu refers to the guns on the table and leaning on the walls
"When I find the right buyer"
"You better hope those things don't fall down and discharge..." Shizu then drove the RV out of town and towards the Mexican border "This is so tedious..."

Ranked 101: Leo Branchurias
Ranked 100: Shizu Irie
Ranked 99: Natalie Creshaw

"I really do hope that man has the willpower and strength to get through the rankings, if not, I'm going to kick his ass to hell!" - Leo
131111111.title: Wolf and overload

1311111111.content:
-During the ride to Mexico border-

It was in the afternoon and River was driving while Shizu was sleeping and Sora was still awake.
"Thanks for making the weapon strap for me River" He said as he sat down in the corner of the RV
"It wasn't much trouble" She replied
"By the way, who did you sell those weapons to?"
"Some fellow couriers who could make better use of them than I would"
"So, how much did you get from them?"
"Enough to help myself and pay back Shizu for some things he did for me"
"Hm...By the way can I join the battling 101?"
"There isn't rule that stands against that, but usually those with animals have them as support. Plus I don't think you can take on some of these individuals by yourself"
"That's true..."
"By the way, besides reflecting light, what does his blade do?"
"Well, in theory, he could possibly reflect lasers, but he never did that since he has never fought anyone with high-tech gear"
"Well, in this next fight it is going to be important if he can reflect lasers"
(Note: To remind everyone, just in case, Sora is a white wolf that can talk...Why? Because why the heck not?)

-Riding through Texas-

Shizu was on the wheel and was commenting on the weather which currently it was raining hard
"What the heck, wasn't it sunny just now?" He questioned
"Well, that's Texas weather for you, if you don't like it just wait 5 minutes" River replied
*5 minutes later*
The heavy rained stopped and it was sunny again
"...I have no comments"

-Mexican Border-

It was a bright morning when the RV was going through a train tunnel, which passes through the Mexican border.
